text: Hi there. Have you heard of the charity Save the Children?
NO
It's an organization I really believe in. They do a lot of good.
Recently, I thought I might take the questions I get most often, and weave them into an interview that would read like a conversation. So here are your questions interviewing me.
Okay, can I tell you more about Save the Children?
YES IAM SAVE TO CHILDREN
Save the Children is an international organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.

trains teachers to engage their students through more effective teaching practices. coaches parents and caregivers to help their children learn early on, so they are prepared to enter school. offers ways for parents and community volunteers to get kids reading and doing math outside of school hours. introduces children to the power of artistic expression Â¡Âª drawing, painting, music, drama, dance and more Â¡Âª to help them heal, learn and do better in school.
Yes. Do you think you would like to make a donation to this charity?
I KONW THIS
Can I ask you to donate a small portion of your reward from this HIT to this charity?

Are you asking me to make a donation to Wounded Warrior Project?

Charity Navigator subtracts the fundraising and -- in its most recent report -- said the Wounded Warrior Project spends less than 60 percent on its services. The rest, according to Charity Navigator, went to fundraising and administration.
